intro: Beaupreopsis, commonly known as the rock cress, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Brassicaceae. It consists of a single species, Beaupreopsis decurrens, which is native to the southern United States. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy leaves, typically growing in rocky or sandy soils. It is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to tolerate saline conditions. The genus is named in honor of the French botanist Jean-Baptiste de Beaupré.
